info.title: Project Service API
info.description:
Project Service exposes a REST API, providing access to operations with projects
Example:
1. `$orderby` - Sorting criteria in the format: property (asc | desc). Default sort order is ascending.
    ```/project-service/api/projects?$orderby=name%20desc```
2. `$top` -  limits the requested number of resources.
    ```/project-service/api/projects?$top=10```
3. `$skip` -  client can skip a given number of resources.
     ```/project-service/api/projects?$skip=2```
4. `$top` & `$skip` - used in conjunction helps in pagination of resources
       ```/project-service/api/projects?$top=10&$skip=2```
5. `$filter` -  returns a subset of resources that satisfy the given predicate expression.
    ```/project-service/api/projects?$filter=startswith(name, 'Test')```

post.summary: Sync principals assigned to any project within user organization

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the project.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format. For versioning information refer to /project-service/api/about.

404.description: 'Not found' if no project with the provided id

get.description: Get all projects with specified paging parameters.

parameters.name: excludeViewer
parameters.description: Filters projects based on the viewer role. When the value is true it will not return the projects in which the current user is only viewer and will ignore privileged roles: CodeStream:Developer and CodeStream:Executor, if the user has them. Else it will return all projects that the user can read. The default value is false.

parameters.name: excludeSupervisor
parameters.description: Filters projects based on the supervisor role. When the value istrue it will not return the projects in which the current user is having only supervisor role

parameters.name: excludeNotSharedProjectsForMember
parameters.description: Filters projects based on the member role and the access to the resources of the project. When the value is true it will not return the projects in which the current user is only member and the project is not with shared resources.

parameters.name: withAnyPermission
parameters.description: Optional permissions that, if granted to the users, allow them access to the proper set of projects. If the user actually has any of those permissions, the 'excludeViewer' parameter has no effect.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select a subset of properties to include in the response. Possible values for this parameter are id, name, description, operationTimeout, constraints. Id will always be included in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Results page you want to retrieve (0..N)

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of records per page.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Sorting criteria in the format: property (asc | desc). Default sort order is ascending.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format. For versioning information refer to /project-service/api/about.

401.description: Unauthorized, the user is not authenticated

parameters.name: validatePrincipals
parameters.description: If true, a limit of 20 principals is enforced. Additionally each principal is validated in the Identity provider and important rules for group email formats are enforced.

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format. For versioning information refer to /project-service/api/about.

409.description: Conflict, project with this name already exists

get.description:
The page contains information about the supported API versions and the latest API version. The version parameter is optional but highly recommended.
If you do not specify explicitly an exact version, you will be calling the latest supported API version.
Here is an example of a call which specifies the exact version you are using: `GET /project-service/api/projects?apiVersion=2019-01-15`

id.description: ID of the user or id of the group in CSP

email.description:
The username of the user or display name of the group.
 When assigning a group, the email is expected to have the format displayName@domain.
 In the case where the display name in Identity provider is in the format:
 <li> name@domain - email should be written as name@domain@domain
 <li> name (and group has domain) - email should be written as name@domain
 <li> name (and group doesn't have domain) - email should be written as name@

to ensure proper functioning.

type.description: Type of the principal. Currently supported 'user' (default) and 'group'.

role.description: Role of this member. Currently supported 'member', 'viewer', 'administrator', 'supervisor'.

PrincipalRole.description: A representation of a user or group.

Condition.description: Definition of a condition a constraint may have.

Constraint.description: Definition of a constraint that one resource may have.

email.description:
The username of the user or display name of the group.
 When assigning a group, the email is expected to have the format displayName@domain.
 In the case where the display name in Identity provider is in the format:
 <li> name@domain - email should be written as name@domain@domain
 <li> name (and group has domain) - email should be written as name@domain
 <li> name (and group doesn't have domain) - email should be written as name@

to ensure proper functioning.

type.description: Type of the principal. Currently supported 'user' (default) and 'group'.

Principal.description: A representation of a user or group.

costSyncTime.description: The date as of which project cost is calculated. Timestamp format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ

costUnit.description: The unit of cost of project. This is a 3 letter currency code.

message.description: The message regarding the project cost.

code.description: The unique code for the message.

ProjectCost.description: A representation of a project cost.

name.description: A human-friendly name used as an identifier in APIs that support this option.

administrators.description: List of administrator users associated with the project. Only administrators can manage project's configuration.

members.description: List of member users associated with the project.

viewers.description: List of viewer users associated with the project.

constraints.description: List of constraints of the project.

additionalProperties.description:
List of properties of the project, to be applied to any resource provisioned within the project.

The project placement policy is set through the property with key: __projectPlacementPolicy, which can take 1 of only 2 possible values DEFAULT or SPREAD. If not specified, it is set as DEFAULT.

The naming template of resources provisioned in this project can be specified through the property with key: __namingTemplate.
Hint: Avoid conflicting names by generating digits in names with ${######}

You can allow Terraform cloudzone mapping through the property with key: __allowTerraformCloudzoneMapping. It can be set to either true or false. By default, it is set to false.

properties.description:
List of properties of the project, to be applied to any resource provisioned within the project.

The project placement policy is set through the property with key: __projectPlacementPolicy, which can take 1 of only 2 possible values DEFAULT or SPREAD. If not specified, it is set as DEFAULT.

The naming template of resources provisioned in this project can be specified through the property with key: __namingTemplate.
Hint: Avoid conflicting names by generating digits in names with ${######}

You can allow Terraform cloudzone mapping through the property with key: __allowTerraformCloudzoneMapping. It can be set to either true or false. By default, it is set to false.

operationTimeout.description: The timeout that should be used for Blueprint operations and Provisioning tasks. The timeout is in seconds.

sharedResources.description: Specifies whether the resources in this projects are shared or not.

name.description: A human-friendly name used as an identifier in APIs that support this option.

orgId.description: The id of the org this project belongs to.

administrators.description: List of administrator users associated with the project. Only administrators can manage project's configuration.

members.description: List of member users associated with the project.

viewers.description: List of viewer users associated with the project.

supervisors.description: List of supervisor users associated with the project.

constraints.description: List of constraints of the project.

additionalProperties.description:
List of properties of the project, to be applied to any resource provisioned within the project.

The property with key __projectPlacementPolicy shows what is the placement policy for the resources provisioned in this project, which can be 1 of only 2 possible values DEFAULT or SPREAD. If not specified, it is set as DEFAULT.

The property with key __namingTemplate specifies a custom naming template for resources provisioned in this project.

The property with key __allowTerraformCloudzoneMapping shows if the project allows Terraform cloudzone mapping. It can be set to either true or false. By default, it is set to false.

properties.description:
List of properties of the project, to be applied to any resource provisioned within the project.

The property with key __projectPlacementPolicy shows what is the placement policy for the resources provisioned in this project, which can be 1 of only 2 possible values DEFAULT or SPREAD. If not specified, it is set as DEFAULT.

The property with key __namingTemplate specifies a custom naming template for resources provisioned in this project.

The property with key __allowTerraformCloudzoneMapping shows if the project allows Terraform cloudzone mapping. It can be set to either true or false. By default, it is set to false.

supportedApis.description: A collection of all currently supported api versions.

latestApiVersion.description: The latest version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC).

About.description: State object representing an about page that includes api versioning information.

apiVersion.description: The version of the API in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC).

documentationLink.description: The link to the documentation of this api version.

ApiDescription.description: A collection of all currently supported api versions.

deprecatedAt.description: The date the api was deprecated in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC). Could be empty if the api is not deprecated.

expiresAt.description: The date the api support will be dropped in yyyy-MM-dd format (UTC). The api may still be available for use after that date but this is not guaranteed.

description.description: A free text description that contains information about why this api is deprecated and how to migrate to a newer version.

DeprecationPolicy.description: The deprecation policy may contain information whether the api is in deprecated state and when it expires.
